sentences.english: His excuse was the platitude ‘boys will be boys.’
sentences.chinese: 他还是那一套理由:“男孩总归是男孩。”

detailed_translations.english: a statement that has been made many times before and is not interesting or clever – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Our sympathies are with the families of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 我们向受害者家庭表示慰问。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sorry for someone who is in a bad situation

sentences.english: The funeral will be held at St. Martin’s Church.
sentences.chinese: 葬礼将在圣马丁教堂举行。

sentences.english: Hundreds of mourners attended the funeral of the two boys.
sentences.chinese: 数百名哀悼者参加了那两个男孩的葬礼。

sentences.english: the minister who conducted the funeral service
sentences.chinese: 主持葬礼的牧师

sentences.english: Nelson’s funeral procession down the Thames
sentences.chinese: 沿泰晤士河而下为纳尔逊送葬的队伍

sentences.english: Ramdas set fire to the funeral pyre .
sentences.chinese: 拉姆达斯点燃了火葬柴堆。

detailed_translations.english: a religious ceremony for burying or cremating someone who has died

sentences.english: a letter of condolence
sentences.chinese: 吊唁信

detailed_translations.english: sympathy for someone who has had something bad happen to them, especially when someone has died

sentences.english: Both countries seem to favour the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 两个国家似乎都更倾向于这份协议。

detailed_translations.english: to prefer someone or something to other things or people, especially when there are several to choose from

name: inappropriate
trans: (对某人[某事物])不恰当的, 不适合的

sentences.english: There is no suggestion that clients have been sold inappropriate policies.
sentences.chinese: 没有迹象表明向客户出售过不适当的保险单。

detailed_translations.english: not suitable or right for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

sentences.english: Students who achieve an acceptable standard will progress to degree studies.
sentences.chinese: 达到一定程度的学生可以进一步攻读学位。

sentences.english: How do we reach an acceptable level of data security?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何使数据安全达到令人满意的程度？

detailed_translations.english: good enough to be used for a particular purpose or to be considered satisfactory

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: respect
trans: 敬重, 尊敬, 尊重, 重视, 注重, 敬意

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

sentences.english: I couldn’t go out with someone for a joke, could you?
sentences.chinese: 我可不能拿谈恋爱当儿戏，对不对？

sentences.english: I never joke about money.
sentences.chinese: 我从不拿钱开玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to make people laugh, especially a funny story or trick
to say things that are intended to be funny and that you do not really mean

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

sentences.english: The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

sentences.english: Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有任何疑问，尽管和我联系。

detailed_translations.english: communication with a person, organization, country etc
to write to or telephone someone

sentences.english: We stood there crying and hugging each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们站在那里哭着互相拥抱。

sentences.english: She went to her daughter and hugged her tightly .
sentences.chinese: 她走到女儿身边，紧紧地拥抱她。

detailed_translations.english: to put your arms around someone and hold them tightly to show love or friendship
to put your arms around someone and hold them tightly to show love or friendship
the action of putting your arms around someone and holding them tightly to show love or friendship

sentences.english: Sarah slapped Aaron across the face.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在阿龙的脸上掴了一巴掌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拍击；侮辱；掌击；掴…的耳光
detailed_translations.english: to hit a surface with a lot of force, making a loud sharp sound
a quick hit with the flat part of your hand

sentences.english: I’ll be back in a minute.
sentences.chinese: 我马上回来。

sentences.english: Put that book back where you found it!
sentences.chinese: 把那本书放回原处！

sentences.english: He was back home by half past eleven.
sentences.chinese: 他是11点半之前回家的。

sentences.english: It’s possible to travel there and back in a day.
sentences.chinese: 到那里一天来回是可以的。

sentences.english: Kirov stepped back a pace.
sentences.chinese: 基洛夫往后退了一步。

detailed_translations.english: in, into, or to the place or position where someone or something was before

sentences.english: He greeted me with a handshake and a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 他与我握手问候，并递给我一杯酒。

sentences.english: Her handshake was warm and firm.
sentences.chinese: 她的握手温暖而有力。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking someone’s right hand and shaking it, which people do when they meet or leave each other or when they have made an agreement

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

name: pleasure
trans: 愉快, 高兴, 乐事, 满足, 乐趣

sentences.english: She sipped her drink with obvious pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 她小口抿着喝饮料，显然很高兴

sentences.english: the simple pleasures of life
sentences.chinese: 生活中的简单乐趣

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of happiness, enjoyment, or satisfaction that you get from an experience

name: lack
trans: 欠缺, 没有, 不足

sentences.english: Alex’s real problem is that he lacks confidence.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯的真正问题是缺乏信心。

detailed_translations.english: to not have something that you need, or not have enough of it

sentences.english: a high standard of cleanliness
sentences.chinese: 很高的卫生标准

detailed_translations.english: the practice of keeping yourself or the things around you clean

sentences.english: Mike’s parents thought I was a disruptive influence (= a person who causes disruption ) .
sentences.chinese: 迈克的父母认为我是个捣蛋分子。

sentences.english: ways to handle disruptive pupils
sentences.chinese: 对付捣乱学生的办法

detailed_translations.english: causing problems and preventing something from continuing in its usual way

sentences.english: What’s that noise?
sentences.chinese: 那是什么声音？

sentences.english: Try not to make a noise when you go upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 上楼时尽量不要弄出声。

sentences.english: There was a lot of noise outside.
sentences.chinese: 外面很吵闹。

sentences.english: Noise levels have been reduced by 20%.
sentences.chinese: 噪音水平下降了20%。

detailed_translations.english: a sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or frightening

sentences.english: It’s a matter of common courtesy to acknowledge letters.
sentences.chinese: 确认收到来信是起码的礼貌。

sentences.english: The president paid a courtesy call on Emperor Akihito.
sentences.chinese: 总统礼节性地拜访了明仁天皇。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour and respect for other people

detailed_translations.chinese: 殷勤的；被承认的；出于礼节的
detailed_translations.english: A courtesy call or a courtesy visit is a formal visit that you pay someone as a way of showing them politeness or respect

sentences.english: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
sentences.chinese: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。

sentences.english: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
sentences.chinese: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

sentences.english: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 许多人反对这些提议。

sentences.english: He first learnt to express himself through movement at his dance classes.
sentences.chinese: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。

sentences.english: Words can’t express (= it is impossible to describe ) how angry we felt.
sentences.chinese: 我们的愤怒无以言表。

sentences.english: London–Gatwick Express/Orient Express (=a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly)
sentences.chinese: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车

sentences.english: Send these books by express.
sentences.chinese: 把这些书用快递寄出去。

detailed_translations.english: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions
a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

sentences.english: I am very fond of Michael.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢迈克尔。

detailed_translations.english: feeling affection for sb, especially sb you have known for a long time

sentences.english: It allows you to harness existing technologies and incorporate them into one application.
sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.english: The next step is to generate the report and then incorporate it as an affiliated document of the master document.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

sentences.english: We want to encourage good teamwork and communication.
sentences.chinese: 我们要鼓励良好的团队合作和沟通。

detailed_translations.english: when a group of people work effectively together

name: principle
trans: 原则, 主义, 原理, 信条

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

sentences.english: Remove the cores, and bake the apples for 40 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 去除果心，然后把苹果烤40分钟。

sentences.english: Debt is at the core of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 债务是问题的关键。

detailed_translations.english: the hard central part of a fruit such as an apple

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

sentences.english: Andy isn’t a very adventurous cook.
sentences.chinese: 安迪不是一个敢于大胆创新的厨师。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱冒险的；大胆的；充满危险的
detailed_translations.english: not afraid of taking risks or trying new things

sentences.english: The old ethic of hard work has given way to a new ethic of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 旧有的崇尚勤勉的道德观已被及时行乐的新观念所取代。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea or belief that influences people’s behaviour and attitudes

name: passionate
trans: 热情的, 激情的, 易怒的

sentences.english: He had a brief but passionate love affair with an older woman.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个比他年长的女子有过一段短暂而炽热的情史。

sentences.english: a very passionate young man
sentences.chinese: 一位感情热烈的年轻人

sentences.english: a passionate lover
sentences.chinese: 富有激情的爱人

sentences.english: a passionate kiss
sentences.chinese: 激情的一吻

detailed_translations.english: showing or involving very strong feelings of sexual love

sentences.english: a politician of rare honesty and courage
sentences.chinese: 具备少见的诚实及勇气的政治家

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

sentences.english: ...a deep sense of humility.
sentences.chinese: …深深的谦卑感。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of not being too proud about yourself – use this to show approval

sentences.english: The company is moving its corporate headquarters (= main offices ) from New York to Houston.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.english: Vince is vice-president of corporate communications.
sentences.chinese: 文斯是负责企业宣传的副总裁。

sentences.english: Corporate America is not about to be converted to the environmentalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 美国企业界不打算投身环保事业。

sentences.english: changing the corporate culture (= the way that people in a corporation think and behave ) to accept family-friendly policies
sentences.chinese: 改变公司文化，采取更关怀家庭的政策

sentences.english: an advertising campaign intended to reinforce our corporate identity
sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.english: The yacht can be hired for corporate hospitality (= entertainment provided by companies for their customers ) .
sentences.chinese: 可以租下这艘游艇用于公司招待客户。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法人团体的， 公司的； 全体的， 共同的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to a corporation

sentences.english: the headquarters of the United Nations
sentences.chinese: 联合国总部

sentences.english: Headquarters in Dublin has/have agreed.
sentences.chinese: 都柏林总部已经同意了

detailed_translations.english: the main building or offices used by a large company or organization

name: branch
trans: (机构, 企业)分部, 部门

sentences.english: After the storm, the ground was littered with twigs and branches.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，满地都是大大小小的树枝。

sentences.english: The topmost branches were full of birds.
sentences.chinese: 树梢上停满了鸟儿。

sentences.english: She now works in our Denver branch.
sentences.chinese: 现在她在我们的丹佛分部工作。

sentences.english: a branch of mathematics/physics/biology etc
sentences.chinese: 数学/物理/生物学等的分支

detailed_translations.english: a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it

name: vertical
trans: 垂直的, 直立的, 纵向的

sentences.english: a vertical line
sentences.chinese: 垂直线

sentences.english: the vertical axis of a graph
sentences.chinese: 图的纵轴

sentences.english: vertical window blinds
sentences.chinese: 垂直百叶窗

sentences.english: The wall is several degrees off the vertical.
sentences.chinese: 这堵墙倾斜了有好几度。

detailed_translations.english: pointing up in a line that forms an angle of 90˚ with a flat surface
a vertical line or position

name: rigid
trans: 严格的; 坚强的; 不变的

sentences.english: rigid plastic
sentences.chinese: 硬塑料

detailed_translations.english: stiff and not moving or bending

sentences.english: proposals to radically restructure Britain’s electronics industry
sentences.chinese: 彻底整顿英国电子行业的提议

detailed_translations.english: to change the way in which something such as a government, business, or system is organized

sentences.english: Use a rolling pin to flatten the dough.
sentences.chinese: 用擀面杖把面团擀平。

sentences.english: The land flattened out as we neared the coast.
sentences.chinese: 我们接近海岸时，地势变平坦了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something flat or flatter, or to become flat or flatter

sentences.english: a rigid social hierarchy
sentences.chinese: 严格的社会等级制度

sentences.english: She worked her way up through the corporate hierarchy to become president.
sentences.chinese: 她在公司一步一步升到了总裁的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a system of organization in which people or things are divided into levels of importance

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: statement
trans: 陈述, 声明, 说法

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

sentences.english: Sara had the task of preparing the agenda for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉的任务是准备会议议程。

sentences.english: I was given the task of building a fire.
sentences.chinese: 我分配到生火的任务。

sentences.english: the skills required to carry out these tasks
sentences.chinese: 执行这些任务所需要的技能

sentences.english: He soon realized the scale of the task he had undertaken .
sentences.chinese: 他很快就意识到他所承担任务的艰巨性了。

sentences.english: Our first task is to gather information.
sentences.chinese: 我们的首要任务是收集信息。

sentences.english: Monkeys can be taught to do simple tasks .
sentences.chinese: 猴子能被教会做一些简单的事。

sentences.english: They have the unenviable task of supervising the most dangerous prison in the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们有个令人头疼的工作，就是管理国家最危险的监狱。

sentences.english: Volunteers had the thankless task of distributing campaign leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 志愿者的任务是分发活动传单，吃力不讨好。

sentences.english: Trying to bring up a small daughter on your own is no easy task .
sentences.chinese: 独自抚养年幼的女儿不是件轻而易举的事。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

sentences.english: It was an effort which was to have painful repercussions.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个将产生沉痛后果的尝试。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反响；弹回；反射；浮动诊胎法；令人不满意的后果
detailed_translations.english: the effects of an action or event, especially bad effects that continue for some time

sentences.english: Some members refused to participate.
sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in an activity or event

sentences.english: a horizontal surface
sentences.chinese: 水平面

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平的；地平线的；同一阶层的
detailed_translations.english: flat and level

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平线，水平面；水平位置
detailed_translations.english: a horizontal line or surface

name: throwback
trans: 像过去存在过的人或事

sentences.english: We underestimated how long it would take to get there.
sentences.chinese: 我们低估了到那里所需的时间。

sentences.english: Never underestimate the power of the press.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要低估新闻界的力量。

detailed_translations.english: to think or guess that something is smaller, cheaper, easier etc than it really is

sentences.english: The monarchy is something of an anachronism these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今君主制是一种过时的体制。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时代错误；不合潮流的人或物
detailed_translations.english: someone or something that seems to belong to the past, not the present

sentences.english: He was an accomplished politician and a crafty autocrat.
sentences.chinese: 他是个有造诣的政治家，也是个狡黠的独裁者。

sentences.english: He was an accomplished politician and a crafty autocrat.
sentences.chinese: 他是个杰出的政治家，也是个狡黠的独裁者。

sentences.english: She wrote a lot of books that exposed the avarice of the authoritarian . the autocracy of the autocrat and the falsity of the autonomy.
sentences.chinese: 她写了许多书，暴露了权力主义者的贪婪，独裁者的独裁政体和自治权的虚伪。

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power over a country

sentences.english: Can you drive?
sentences.chinese: 你会开车吗？

sentences.english: We watched Dad drive the posts into the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着爸爸把木桩打入地里。

sentences.english: With a few loud whistles, they drove the donkeys out of the enclosure.
sentences.chinese: 随着几声响亮的哨声，他们把驴子赶出了围栏。

detailed_translations.english: to make a car, truck, bus etc move along

sentences.english: He earns nearly £20,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 他每年挣近20,000英镑。

sentences.english: You don’t earn much money being a nurse.
sentences.chinese: 当护士挣钱并不多。

sentences.english: He did all sorts of jobs to earn a living.
sentences.chinese: 他为谋生什么活都干。

sentences.english: I was the only person in the house who was earning.
sentences.chinese: 我是家里唯一上班挣钱的人。

sentences.english: She was earning good money at the bank.
sentences.chinese: 她在银行工作，收入不错。

sentences.english: You could earn a higher rate of interest elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 你在别处可以获得更高的利率。

detailed_translations.english: to receive a particular amount of money for the work that you do

sentences.english: Having begun my life in a children's home, I have great empathy with the little ones.
sentences.chinese: 在一家儿童福利院长大使我对这些小孩子们怀有深深的同感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同感， 移情； 全神贯注
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand other people’s feelings and problems

sentences.english: an economic policy that caused great hardship for many people
sentences.chinese: 造成许多人贫困的经济政策

sentences.english: Many students are suffering severe financial hardship.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生经济非常困难。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes your life difficult or unpleasant, especially a lack of money, or the condition of having a difficult life

sentences.english: a rigid social hierarchy
sentences.chinese: 严格的社会等级制度

sentences.english: She worked her way up through the corporate hierarchy to become president.
sentences.chinese: 她在公司一步一步升到了总裁的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a system of organization in which people or things are divided into levels of importance

sentences.english: the government’s tight monetary policy
sentences.chinese: 政府从紧的货币政策

sentences.english: objects of little monetary value
sentences.chinese: 不值钱的物件

detailed_translations.english: relating to money, especially all the money in a particular country

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

sentences.english: Leon Sullivan was my mentor and my friend.
sentences.chinese: 利昂·沙利文既是我的导师，也是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person

sentences.english: child development
sentences.chinese: 儿童发育

sentences.english: The funds will be used for marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将用于市场营销和产品开发。

detailed_translations.english: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced

sentences.english: I walked nervously up the garden path towards the front door.
sentences.chinese: 我提心吊胆地沿着花园的小道向前门走去。

sentences.english: a well-worn path across the grass
sentences.chinese: 草地上被踏出的小径

sentences.english: Follow the path along the river to the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 沿着河边的小路走到那座桥。

sentences.english: a path leading to the summer house
sentences.chinese: 通往避暑别墅的小径

detailed_translations.english: a track that has been made deliberately or made by many people walking over the same ground

name: advance
trans: 促进, 改善, 加速

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: tailor
trans: 裁制; 使合适; 修改; 做裁缝

sentences.english: In his youth his father bound him out to a tailor.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻时他父亲叫他去给一个裁缝当学徒。

sentences.english: Treatment is tailored to the needs of each patient.
sentences.chinese: 治疗方案是针对各个病人的需要而制订的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make men’s clothes, that are measured to fit each customer perfectly
to make something so that it is exactly right for someone’s particular needs or for a particular purpose

sentences.english: He lacks charisma.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏个人魅力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 魅力；神授的能力；非凡的领导力
detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to attract and interest other people and make them admire you

sentences.english: She didn’t have the courage to admit to her deception.
sentences.chinese: 她没有勇气承认自己的欺骗行为。

sentences.english: He was convicted of obtaining money by deception .
sentences.chinese: 他被判犯有诈骗钱财罪。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately making someone believe something that is not true

name: just
trans: 公道的, 公正的, 公平的

sentences.english: A good strong cup of coffee is just what I need right now.
sentences.chinese: 我现在正需要喝一杯浓浓的咖啡。

sentences.english: The house was large and roomy; just right for us.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子大而宽敞，正合我们的需要。

sentences.english: She looks just like her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去就像她妈妈。

sentences.english: It’s nothing serious – just a small cut.
sentences.chinese: 不要紧，只不过是个小伤口。

sentences.english: John’s just told me that he’s getting married.
sentences.chinese: 约翰刚刚告诉我他要结婚了。

detailed_translations.english: exactly

name: keen
trans: 良好的, 敏锐的, 灵敏的, 敏捷的

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

sentences.english: the basic fairness of the judicial system
sentences.chinese: 司法制度的基本公正性

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being fair

sentences.english: The head teacher is very approachable.
sentences.chinese: 校长非常平易近人。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to talk to

name: visionary
trans: 空想家, 好幻想的人, 梦想者

sentences.english: Under his visionary leadership, the city prospered.
sentences.chinese: 在他富有远见的领导下，这座城市蓬勃发展。

detailed_translations.english: existing only in someone’s mind and unlikely to ever exist in the real world

detailed_translations.chinese: 空想家；梦想者；有眼力的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who has clear ideas and strong feelings about the way something should be in the future

sentences.english: These dogs are absolutely fearless.
sentences.chinese: 这些狗什么都不怕。

sentences.english: a fearless explorer
sentences.chinese: 一个无畏的探险者

detailed_translations.english: not afraid of anything

name: inspiring
trans: 令人振奋的, 激励人的, 鼓舞人心的

sentences.english: inspiring music
sentences.chinese: 激励人心的音乐

sentences.english: King was a great orator and an inspiring leader.
sentences.chinese: 金是伟大的演说家和鼓舞人心的领袖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼓舞人心的；灌输的；启发灵感的
detailed_translations.english: giving people a feeling of excitement and a desire to do something great

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼓舞；激发；使感悟（inspire的ing形式）

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.english: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

name: circumstance
trans: 环境, 情况, 形式

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

sentences.english: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.english: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
sentences.chinese: 证据就在档案里，但没有人把它们联系起来。

sentences.english: Students often see little connection between school and the rest of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 学生往往看不到上学和今后生活的联系。

sentences.english: He demonstrated the close connection between social conditions and health.
sentences.chinese: 他证明了社会条件和健康之间的密切联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连接； 联系； 连接物， 连接点； 亲戚
detailed_translations.english: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

name: mute
trans: 使声音(尤指乐器声)减弱, 柔和

sentences.english: Billy continued to stand there, mute and defiant.
sentences.chinese: 比利还是站在那儿一声不吭，一副不服气的样子。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is mute does not speak, or refuses to speak
to make the sound of something quieter, or make it disappear completely
a small piece of metal, rubber etc that you place over or into a musical instrument to make it sound softer

sentences.english: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

sentences.english: ‘He's gone! ’ Viv echoed.
sentences.chinese: “他去了！”维夫重复道。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
to repeat what someone else has just said

sentences.english: I’ve already seen a few movies of this type.
sentences.chinese: 我已经看过几部这种类型的影片了。

sentences.english: He types with two fingers.
sentences.chinese: 他用两个手指打字。

detailed_translations.english: one member of a group of people or things that have similar features or qualities
to write something using a computer or a typewriter

sentences.english: During the race Mr. Taylor talks to the driver using a headset.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛中，泰勒先生用耳麦与车手通话。

detailed_translations.english: a set of headphones, often with a microphone attached

sentences.english: a child’s attachment to its mother
sentences.chinese: 孩子对母亲的依恋

sentences.english: The vacuum cleaner has various attachments.
sentences.chinese: 这台真空吸尘器有各种附件。

sentences.english: the attachments that secure your boots firmly to the skis
sentences.chinese: 把靴子牢牢固定在滑雪板上的扣件

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you like or love someone or something and that you would be unhappy without them

sentences.english: Paul has strong opinions on most subjects.
sentences.chinese: 保罗在大多数问题上观点激烈。

sentences.english: The subjects covered in this chapter are exercise and nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 本章涵盖的主题是运动和营养。

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目； 学科； 主语
detailed_translations.english: the thing you are talking about or considering in a conversation, discussion, book, film etc
to force a country or group of people to be ruled by you, and control them very strictly

sentences.english: I asked Clive where he was going, but he didn’t reply.
sentences.chinese: 我问克莱夫到哪儿去，但他没有回答。

sentences.english: Sorry it took me so long to reply.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我过了这么久才回复。

sentences.english: ‘Did you see Simon today?’ ‘Of course,’ Nathalie replied with a smile.
sentences.chinese: “你今天见到西蒙了吗？”“当然啦。”纳萨莉笑着答道。

sentences.english: I tried calling, but there was no reply.
sentences.chinese: 我试着打电话去，但没有人接。

detailed_translations.english: to answer someone by saying or writing something
something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying

sentences.english: a working model (= one with parts which move ) of a steam engine
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机车的活动模型

sentences.english: a top fashion model
sentences.chinese: 顶级时装模特

detailed_translations.english: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.english: The retail value would be around $500.
sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else
to be sold for a particular price in a shop

sentences.english: The bulk of consumers are based in towns.
sentences.chinese: 大多数消费者都是城镇居民。

sentences.english: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.
sentences.chinese: 面团会发酵到原来的两倍大。

detailed_translations.english: the main or largest part of something

sentences.english: They are often available at a discount.
sentences.chinese: 它们经常可以以折扣价买到。

sentences.english: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand.
sentences.chinese: 这已经迫使多家航空公司对机票大幅打折以刺激需求。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the usual price of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 将…打折扣； 不信； 漠视， 低估
detailed_translations.english: If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price

sentences.english: The family is the basic social unit of modern society.
sentences.chinese: 家庭是现代社会的基本单位。

sentences.english: control/display/filter etc unit
sentences.chinese: 控制/显示/过滤等装置

detailed_translations.english: a thing, person, or group that is regarded as one single whole part of something larger

sentences.english: the shouts of street vendors
sentences.chinese: 街头小贩的吆喝声

detailed_translations.chinese: 卖主；小贩；供应商；[贸易] 自动售货机
detailed_translations.english: someone who sells things, especially on the street

sentences.english: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin .
sentences.chinese: 有人在页边写了条批注。

sentences.english: Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.
sentences.chinese: 采用双倍行距和宽阔的页边空白，以便留出地方写评注。

sentences.english: the western margin of southern Africa
sentences.chinese: 非洲南部的西隅

detailed_translations.english: the empty space at the side of a page

sentences.english: Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆举起双手，做出绝望的手势。

sentences.english: The Queen has now made a gesture towards public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 女王现在摆出了尊重民意的姿态。

detailed_translations.english: a movement of part of your body, especially your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel

sentences.english: the very real historical and cultural differences between our two societies
sentences.chinese: 我们两个社会之间非常现实的历史和文化差异

sentences.english: the desire to maintain a distinct cultural identity
sentences.chinese: 保持独特的文化特征的愿望

sentences.english: It is important to look at the political and cultural context in which the novel was written.
sentences.chinese: 要考虑小说创作时的政治和文化背景，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: people who share the same cultural background
sentences.chinese: 有着相同文化背景的人

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to a particular society and its way of life

name: sensitivity
trans: (话题等)棘手、敏感、容易引起纷争

sentences.english: Each user should have access to a security level based upon the level of data sensitivity he or she can see.
sentences.chinese: 根据用户可以看到的数据的敏感性级别，每个用户都应该可以访问某个安全级别。

sentences.english: The authentication mode you choose for your environment will be determined by the level of sensitivity of your data.
sentences.chinese: 应该为您的环境选择什么样的身份验证模式，这是由数据的敏感级别来决定的。

sentences.english: The sensitivity of the test meets WHO standards for detecting the toxin in drinking water.
sentences.chinese: 这种测试的灵敏度满足了世界卫生组织探测饮用水毒物的标准。

sentences.english: The party's share of the vote fell by ten percentage points.
sentences.chinese: 该党的得票率下跌了十个百分点。

sentences.english: Here are the main points of the news.
sentences.chinese: 以下是新闻摘要。

sentences.english: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
sentences.chinese: 有三个要点我们必须记住。

sentences.english: He is three points behind the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他落后领先者三分。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or unit on a scale of measurement

name: comfortable
trans: 自在的, 无忧无虑的

sentences.english: The bed wasn’t particularly comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 这床不大舒服。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel physically relaxed, without any pain or without being too hot, cold etc

sentences.english: There was a brief silence before anyone answered.
sentences.chinese: 沉默了片刻才有人回答。

sentences.english: ‘Silence in court!’ roared the judge.
sentences.chinese: “法庭上请保持肃静！”法官吼道。

sentences.english: The accused exercised his right to silence (= the legal right to choose to say nothing ) .
sentences.chinese: 被告行使了沉默权。

sentences.english: She held up her hand to silence the children.
sentences.chinese: 她抬手示意孩子们安静下来。

detailed_translations.english: complete quiet because nobody is talking
to make someone stop talking, or stop something making a noise

sentences.english: Losing weight is an indirect result of smoking cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟间接导致体重减轻。

sentences.english: The indirect effects of climate change may be profound.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化造成的间接影响可能是深远的。

sentences.english: George’s comments were an indirect way of blaming me.
sentences.chinese: 乔治的评论转弯抹角地指责了我。

detailed_translations.english: not directly caused by something

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

sentences.english: He leaned forward , his elbows resting on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他身体前倾，胳膊肘撑在桌子上。

sentences.english: The crowd surged forwards.
sentences.chinese: 人群向前涌去。

sentences.english: The next scene takes the story forward five years.
sentences.chinese: 下一个场面是描述故事中五年后的情况。

detailed_translations.english: towards a place or position that is in front of you

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

name: reassure
trans: 消除某人的恐惧或疑虑; 恢复某人的信心; 使某人放心

sentences.english: Teachers reassured anxious parents.
sentences.chinese: 老师们安慰焦急的父母。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation

name: blunder
trans: 愚蠢的错误,笨拙的错误

sentences.english: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
sentences.chinese: 他们犯了大错，让他做这份工作。

sentences.english: to make a terrible blunder
sentences.chinese: 犯大错

detailed_translations.english: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
a careless or stupid mistake

name: ashamed
trans: 惭愧的, 羞耻的, 不要意思的

sentences.english: Everyone cries sometimes – it’s nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

sentences.english: ‘You are an idiot, ’ he tells them.
sentences.chinese: ‘你确实是傻瓜，’他对他们说。

sentences.english: Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的读者，假设你是一个白痴。再假设你是一名国会成员。不过我的话说重复了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is mentally ill or has a very low level of intelligence

name: awkward
trans: 尴尬的, 不合适的, 棘手的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: ordinarily
trans: 通常, 大概, 普通

sentences.english: Ordinarily, he didn’t like to go to the movies.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说他不喜欢去看电影。

sentences.english: This is not the price at which the CD is ordinarily sold.
sentences.chinese: 这不是这张CD平时卖的价格。

detailed_translations.english: usually

sentences.english: a high level of political aspiration
sentences.chinese: 崇高的政治抱负

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的愿望； 志向， 抱负
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or achieve something

name: offensive
trans: 冒犯的, 得罪人的, 唐突的, 无礼的

sentences.english: I found her remarks deeply offensive.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得她的话令人非常恼火。

sentences.english: offensive behaviour
sentences.chinese: 无礼的行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 冒犯的，无礼的；进攻的，攻击性的
detailed_translations.english: very rude or insulting and likely to upset people
a planned military attack involving large forces over a long period

sentences.english: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌，她就会难为情。

sentences.english: He looked embarrassed when I asked him where he’d been.
sentences.chinese: 我问他去了哪里，他显得很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

sentences.english: It was careless of him to leave the door unlocked.
sentences.chinese: 他忘了锁门，真是粗心大意。

sentences.english: a careless mistake
sentences.chinese: 粗心造成的错误

sentences.english: careless driving
sentences.chinese: 粗心驾驶

sentences.english: Careless talk can be disastrous for a business.
sentences.chinese: 谈话不慎有时会给企业带来灾难性的损失。

sentences.english: She gave a careless shrug.
sentences.chinese: 她漠然地耸了耸肩。

detailed_translations.english: not paying enough attention to what you are doing, so that you make mistakes, damage things etc

sentences.english: a rude remark
sentences.chinese: 粗鲁的话

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to be rude, but I had to leave early.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想显得无礼，但我不得不早走。

detailed_translations.english: speaking or behaving in a way that is not polite and is likely to offend or annoy people

name: inappropriate
trans: (对某人[某事物])不恰当的, 不适合的

sentences.english: There is no suggestion that clients have been sold inappropriate policies.
sentences.chinese: 没有迹象表明向客户出售过不适当的保险单。

detailed_translations.english: not suitable or right for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

sentences.english: a hard wooden chair
sentences.chinese: 一把硬木椅

sentences.english: the hardest substance known to man
sentences.chinese: 已知的最硬物质

sentences.english: After months without rain, the ground was too hard to plough.
sentences.chinese: 数月无雨，土地坚硬难犁。

sentences.english: This year’s exam was much harder than last year’s.
sentences.chinese: 今年的考试比去年的难得多。

detailed_translations.english: firm, stiff, and difficult to press down, break, or cut

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
sentences.chinese: 对，回答正确。

sentences.english: Is that the right time ?
sentences.chinese: 那个时间对吗？

sentences.english: I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
exactly in a particular position or place
used to check if what you have said is correct
exactly in a particular position or place

sentences.english: I’m so sorry, I do apologize.
sentences.chinese: 非常对不起，我真心道歉。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that you are sorry that you have done something wrong

name: sincere
trans: 真诚的, 诚挚的, 真实的

sentences.english: Please accept my sincere apologies .
sentences.chinese: 请接受我真诚的道歉。

sentences.english: his sincere desire to find out the truth
sentences.chinese: 他想查明真相的真切愿望

detailed_translations.english: a feeling, belief, or statement that is sincere is honest and true, and based on what you really feel and believe

sentences.english: He didn’t look the sort of man to forgive and forget (= forgive someone and no longer think about it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他看上去不是那种不记仇的人。

detailed_translations.english: to stop being angry with someone and stop blaming them, although they have done something wrong

name: unacceptable
trans: 难以接受的, 不受欢迎的

sentences.english: I found her attitude totally unacceptable.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得她的态度让人完全不能接受。

sentences.english: unacceptable levels of pollution
sentences.chinese: 无法容忍的污染程度

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能接受的；不受欢迎的
detailed_translations.english: something that is unacceptable is so wrong or bad that you think it should not be allowed

name: stupid
trans: 愚蠢的, 笨的, 迟钝的, 麻木的, 无知觉的

sentences.english: stupid mistakes
sentences.chinese: 愚蠢的错误

sentences.english: That was a stupid thing to say.
sentences.chinese: 那样说可真傻。

sentences.english: I can’t believe Kate was stupid enough to get involved in this.
sentences.chinese: 我简直不能相信凯特这么傻，会介入这件事情。

sentences.english: It was stupid of me to lose my temper.
sentences.chinese: 我大发脾气，真是太愚蠢了。

detailed_translations.english: showing a lack of good sense or good judgment
an insulting way of talking to someone who you think is being stupid

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

sentences.english: I’ll excuse you this time, but don’t be late again.
sentences.chinese: 这次我原谅你，但别再迟到了。

sentences.english: Please excuse my bad handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 请原谅，我的字写得不好。

sentences.english: Can I be excused from swimming today? I have a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我今天能不游泳吗？我感冒了。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for doing something that is not seriously wrong, such as being rude or careless
a reason that you invent to explain an action and to hide your real intentions

name: beyond
trans: 在 较远的一边, 超越

sentences.english: They crossed the mountains and headed for the valleys beyond.
sentences.chinese: 他们翻过山，向更远处的山谷进发。

sentences.english: Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
sentences.chinese: 河的那边，牛在吃草。

sentences.english: She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
sentences.chinese: 她驱车穿过西港，在几英里外的一个路边旅馆停了下来。

detailed_translations.english: on or to the further side of something

sentences.english: It was a tough race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.english: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.english: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.chinese: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.english: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

sentences.english: Her body was found in a pool of blood.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体被发现倒在血泊之中。

sentences.english: Blood oozed from a cut on his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 血从他额头的伤口里渗了出来。

sentences.english: There’s Irish blood on his mother’s side.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲有爱尔兰血统。

detailed_translations.english: the red liquid that your heart pumps around your body

sentences.english: a double sink
sentences.chinese: 双水槽

sentences.english: a double wardrobe
sentences.chinese: 双门衣柜

sentences.english: the great double doors of the cathedral
sentences.chinese: 大教堂宏伟的双开大门

sentences.english: Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
sentences.chinese: 不可以在双黄线处停车。

sentences.english: The city was enclosed by walls of double thickness.
sentences.chinese: 该城被两倍厚的墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same

sentences.english: a honeymoon suite
sentences.chinese: 蜜月套房

sentences.english: a suite of rooms for palace guests
sentences.chinese: 王室贵宾套房

detailed_translations.chinese: 套间； 一套家具； 套， 组， 系列
detailed_translations.english: a set of rooms, especially expensive ones in a hotel

name: king-size
trans: 特长且大的, 加长型的

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: complimentary
trans: 赞赏的,恭维的,表示敬意的

sentences.english: There was a complimentary bottle of champagne in the hotel room.
sentences.chinese: 酒店客房里有一瓶免费赠送的香槟。

sentences.english: I’ve got some complimentary tickets for the theatre tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我有几张今晚的免费戏票。

detailed_translations.english: given free to people

sentences.english: The Coca-Cola bottle is one of the classic designs of the last century.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐瓶是上个世纪的经典设计之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最优秀的，典型的，标准的；传统式样的，典雅的
detailed_translations.english: having all the features that are typical or expected of a particular thing or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学名著， 经典作品， 杰作； 优秀的典范； 古典文学， 古典语文研究
detailed_translations.english: a book, play, or film that is important and has been admired for a long time

sentences.english: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
sentences.chinese: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

sentences.english: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
sentences.chinese: 河水流速变慢时，一层泥土便沉积下来。

sentences.english: I’d like to make a deposit (= pay some money ) into my savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

sentences.english: fatty deposits on the heart
sentences.chinese: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

detailed_translations.english: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

sentences.english: Increased motivation is more than an incidental benefit of reward schemes.
sentences.chinese: 积极性提高不仅仅是奖励计划附带的益处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 附带的；偶然的；容易发生的
detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in connection with something else that is more important

detailed_translations.chinese: 附带事件；偶然事件；杂项

sentences.english: Leave the battery on charge all night.
sentences.chinese: 让电池充一晚上的电

sentences.english: Please charge your glasses and drink a toast to the bride and groom!
sentences.chinese: 请各位斟满酒杯向新娘、新郎敬酒！

detailed_translations.english: electricity that is put into a piece of electrical equipment such as a battery
to fill a glass

name: broken
trans: 被破坏的, 受伤的, 断裂的

sentences.english: Mind the broken glass.
sentences.chinese: 当心碎玻璃。

sentences.english: a badly broken leg
sentences.chinese: 严重骨折的腿

sentences.english: Gibbs had an X-ray, which revealed no broken bones.
sentences.chinese: 吉布斯拍了X光片，显示没有骨折。

detailed_translations.english: in small pieces because it has been hit, dropped etc

sentences.english: They"ll quickly adjust her thermostat to high heat.
sentences.chinese: 他们会很快调整自己恒温器到高热量。

sentences.english: Thankfully these days I’m the one that controls the thermostat, so I keep it as warm as I like.
sentences.chinese: 谢天谢地的是这些天由我来调节恒温器，因此我将它设定在我最喜欢的充满暖意的室温。

detailed_translations.english: an instrument used for keeping a room or a machine at a particular temperature

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…配备恒温器；用恒温器控制

sentences.english: a smoke detector
sentences.chinese: 烟雾探测器

sentences.english: a metal detector
sentences.chinese: 金属探测器

detailed_translations.english: a machine or piece of equipment that finds or measures something

sentences.english: I’ll go and find you some clean sheets and blankets.
sentences.chinese: 我去给你们找些干净的床单和毯子。

sentences.english: white cotton sheets
sentences.chinese: 白色的棉布床单

sentences.english: a sheet of paper with names and numbers on it
sentences.chinese: 写了姓名和电话号码的一张纸

sentences.english: a sheet of glass
sentences.chinese: 一块玻璃

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of thin cloth that you put on a bed to lie on or lie under

sentences.english: a stack of dirty dishes in the sink
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽里的一堆脏碟子

sentences.english: How did you get so dirty?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会弄得这么脏？

sentences.english: kids telling dirty jokes
sentences.chinese: 讲着下流笑话的年轻人

sentences.english: a dirty magazine
sentences.chinese: 色情杂志

detailed_translations.english: covered in or marked by an unwanted substance

sentences.english: We’ve decided to stain the shelves blue.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把架子涂成蓝色。

detailed_translations.english: to change the colour of something, especially something made of wood, by using a special liquid
a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

sentences.english: The building has been carpeted throughout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里上上下下都铺了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…上铺地毯，把地毯铺在…上；斥责
detailed_translations.english: to cover a floor with carpet
heavy woven material for covering floors or stairs, or a piece of this material

name: option
trans: 选择, 选择权, 选择自由

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

sentences.english: an affluent upscale audience
sentences.chinese: 富裕的高消费观众

detailed_translations.chinese: 迎合高层次消费者的；质优价高的
detailed_translations.english: relating to people from a high social class who have a lot of money

sentences.english: The hotel is in the city centre, close to shops and local amenities.
sentences.chinese: 该酒店位于市中心，紧邻商店和当地的便利设施。

sentences.english: houses that lack basic amenities
sentences.chinese: 缺乏基本生活设施的房屋

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适；礼仪；愉快；便利设施
detailed_translations.english: something that makes a place comfortable or easy to live in

sentences.english: an attentive audience
sentences.chinese: 聚精会神的听众

detailed_translations.english: listening to or watching someone carefully because you are interested

sentences.english: a spacious living area
sentences.chinese: 宽敞的居住空间

detailed_translations.english: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

sentences.english: a luxurious 30-room villa
sentences.chinese: 一栋有30个房间的豪华度假别墅

detailed_translations.english: very expensive, beautiful, and comfortable

name: incompetent
trans: 无能力的, 不称职的

sentences.english: an incompetent manager
sentences.chinese: 不称职的经理

sentences.english: weak incompetent leadership
sentences.chinese: 软弱不称职的领导

sentences.english: The president turned furiously on his staff. "I'm surrounded by incompetents!"
sentences.chinese: 董事长愤怒地指责其职员，“我身边全是些没用的人！”

detailed_translations.chinese: 无能力的，不胜任的；不合适的；不适当的；无力的
detailed_translations.english: not having the ability or skill to do a job properly
An incompetent is someone who is incompetent

sentences.english: a high standard of cleanliness
sentences.chinese: 很高的卫生标准

detailed_translations.english: the practice of keeping yourself or the things around you clean

name: quitter
trans: 轻言放弃的人,无志气的人,懦夫

sentences.english: He won't resign because he's not a quitter.
sentences.chinese: 他不会辞职，因为他不是个半途而废的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does not have the determination or courage to finish something that is difficult
